commit_message: Changed the NRF.py to accept input/output directly from snakemake

Changes to generalise the pipeline for custom usage

Config file now contains paths and global variables
Fixed the paths structure and added the DAG rules

strand cross-correlation script and peak calling modification

Modified the rule peakcalling so it works with the config file. Started writing the script for strand cross-correlation.

Descriptions

Added descritipns to each section.

rule_peak_calling

Added the rule peak calling. Samples 35 and 36 are controls and samples 59 and 60 are the targets.

rule NRF

Calculating the nonredundant fraction. NRF = Unique start positions of uniquely mappable reads / Uniquely mappable reads. Wrote the python script that reads in the files, calculates the NRF and then out the value to a txt file.

Rule Align

Wrote rule align. It aligns the data to the reference genome. Only uniquely mapped reads are extracted. Then the output is converted to bam files, and files generated as intermediates are removed.

rule trimgalore and bowtie2_index

Added rules trimgalore and bowtie2_index

Fastq to fastqc

Wrote the rule fastq_to_fastqc. Generated fastqc files and reports.
Added folder fastqc to gitignore.

Bruce's first commit

Deleted the 'temp' function from the Snakemake file
Added some more folder to the ignore list

Added the gitignore and readme, and modified the Snakefile

Git is now ignoring any changes in the data and .snakemake folders
The 'sra_to_fastq' rule is now producing a log file
The readme file contains a description of the analysis and of the next steps

Added the accession list and the initial Snakemake

The SraAccList.txt provide the identifiers for the SRA files
The Snakefile contains the 'all' and 'sra_to_fastq' rules
